Text:
...And no shoddy hotel could ever hope to hold
a torch to our meals here at the Garden.

Well, in Delta's case, it's not the taste that matters
so much as how much she can eat.

Ulp, please don't say that... That kind of quantity-
over-quality thinking makes my head hurt.

This is what we eat on a daily basis, after all.
And... I'm also a bit irked by those who are
picky eaters.
Are you referring to Zeta?

Yes. I wish both Delta and Zeta would show even the
slightest amount of gratitude...

We proceed down the corridor as we chat.
Eventually the dining hall comes into view.
Good morning, everyone.
Good morning, Lady Alpha.

Good morning. Gamma, I heard you had some trouble
this morning.
Food, food, food...

Missing are Zeta, who is away on her mission,
and Eta, who had been researching through the
night.

Apart from them, all of the Seven Shadows are
at the table.

My apologies for the concern. But the incident has
been resolved.
Gamma looked downcast at Beta's insinuation.

Delta, have you been waiting? I said you could
go ahead and eat.

Delta, who had been the first one to the dining hall,
has been waiting patiently.
In front of her is an empty, pristine plate.

Yeah, I have been. I decided to wait until you got
back.

So you say, but are you sure you didn't
just lick your plate clean?

Awoo, no way! Lady Alpha would get mad at me
for bad manners!
Hehe, true. Well, it was good of you to wait, Delta.
But...awoo...I-I can't wait anymore... Awoo...

Oh dear, you're drooling. I think someone is at
her limit.

Waiting any longer would be cruel to poor Delta,
so I clap my hands to summon the servers.
Pardon me.

A cart bearing our food clatters up alongside
the dining table.

Today we have eggs Benedict and baguettes,
with a smoked salmon salad.
There is also consomm√© and orange juice. Enjoy.

The server places the dishes on the table
with practiced hands.
Bacon, bacon! Ruff, ruff!
Don't forget your vegetables, Delta.
Yeah, Lady Alpha already told me!
Hmm, what to do... Maybe I'll let Delta have my meat.
Oh, are you on a diet?

N-No, of course I'm not...! Perhaps meat is a tad
too heavy in the morning?
Oh, can I have milk instead of orange juice?
Of course.
Oh, drinking milk so we can get even bigger, are we?
That's not the nicest look you're giving me...
...I'll have milk, too. And chicken instead of bacon!
N-Now, my lady...?
Are you saying I can't have it?

(Epsilon has turned her piercing gaze on the server.
Oh dear, it appears she is in need of a little ego fix.)

Epsilon, these meals are prepared daily. This is not
a restaurant or other such places where you can
order as you please.
Geh...

Furthermore, let's not delay our meal any longer,
shall we? Starting tomorrow, you can relay any
similar requests you have in advance.
Y-Yes, ma'am...
The very relieved server exits the room.

Altering the menu on the spot is quite difficult.
Eta does often request for the chefs to add
more sugar, though.

All that brain-work does make one crave sweet things,
so I know how she feels...

Ruff! Eta is scary. I have to watch out so she doesn't
use me in her experiments...

Isn't Zeta on an infiltration mission? How long was it
supposed to last?
I hope she comes home soon.
I'd be fine if she didn't come home!

Seriously, even among therianthropes, cats and dogs
have completely opposite natures. I do understand
why you fight, though.

She always calls me a stupid dog! It makes me mad!
Grr!

There, there. Just focus on your tasty meal and
forget all about her.
The food, drinks, and utensils are all in place.

...We give thanks to Shadow, and all those who have
gathered here by his guidance to partake in this meal.
We all close our eyes in silence for a moment.

(After all, it was Shadow...the source of this meal
and everything else...who had allowed us to keep
on living.)
Now, let's eat!!!
